result.execSummary:
The defendant Devan L Gladden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  AODA and any follow through treatment at the discretion of the agent.  No use/possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid prescription.  Must notify agent w/in 24 hours if a prescription is received.  Take/maintain prescription medication as prescribed.  Not to go to taverns/bars/liquor stores.  Absolute sobriety.  Random UA's per agent.  Any other conditions per agent.  Two (2) days credit if probation would be revoked.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devan L Gladden

records.addlTxt:
10:13 AM Defendant Devan L Gladden in court.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger in court for Devan L Gladden.  Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and appearances.  Atty Getsinger states they are resolved and files plea paperwork.  State states the joint recommendations.  Atty Getsinger and DE are in agreement.  Court questions DE on plea agreement.  DE agrees and pleads NC to Ct 1 in 22CF187.  Court accepts plea/finds DE guilty.  State notes victim rights have been complied with - nothing further to provide the Court - and makes statement on behalf of the joint recommendations.  Atty Getsinger makes statement on behalf of DE.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Court reminds DE re: voting rights and felony firearms warnings.

18CF430
Ct 1:  NC - DPA revoked
IMPOSE and STAY 7 months jail w/huber and EMP if available
**Probation for 2 years
$518.00 costs/surcharges to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided
One (1) day credit if probation would be revoked
Ct 2:  Dismissed/read-in

22CF187
Ct 1:  NC
**Probation for 12 months concurrent to 18CF430
$543.00 costs/surcharges to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided
Two (2) days credit if probation would be revoked
Ct 2:  Dismissed/read-in

**Conditions of probation in both cases:
AODA and follow through treatment at discretion of agent
Absolute sobriety
No use/possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid prescription
Take/maintain prescription medication as prescribed
Inform agent of any prescriptions w/in 24 hours
No bars/taverns/liquor stores
Random UA's per agent
Any other conditions per agent
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devan L Gladden in court.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger in court for Devan L Gladden.  Court states cases and appearances.  Atty Getsinger states status and provides written waiver of prelim in 22CF187.  Court questions DE on written waiver of prelim/accepts/finds probable cause/binds DE over in 22CF187.  Atty Getsinger acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and stands mute.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties and enters NG pleas.  Atty Getsinger states in 18CF430 the DPA was extended to 6/1/22 but due to new case being filed they are not contesting revocation of the DPA.  Requests both matters be set out about one month in hopes of resolving both matters.  Court questions DE on revocation of the DPA.  DE is in agreement.  Court orders revocation of the DPA in 18CF430 and enters conviction on Ct 1.  Counsel to speak to the JA re: scheduling after court today.  Bonds continued.

2:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devan L Gladden in court.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger in court for Devan L Gladden.  Atty Getsinger explains missed court appearance due to mix up of court dates.  State does not object to reinstating previous bond.  Court reinstates previous cash bond.  Atty Getsinger suggests setting matter for a prelim waiver and arraignment.  No objection from State.  Matter reset.  Court quashes warrant.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Arraignment scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Waiver of Prelim on August 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Return on warrant on June 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:30 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess and intern Dan Moon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devan L Gladden not in court.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger in court for Devan L Gladden.  State requests warrant and forfeiture of bond.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.   Begin bond forfeiture

Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE qualifies for public defender representation.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  State recommends cash bond as Court's discretion.  Atty Getsinger recommends a signature bond.  $25.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact with K.L.D. or her residence.  May return one time with prior notice and with LE to retrieve any personal belongings.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
